result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond in court.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to amend to count 1 to 9.01.   Defendants no contest plea;   Court grants and orders.  $267.50 forfeiture;   60 Days to Pay or payment plan.   Apply $200 from the DRI  case 15CM283

15CM283  DRI.

Defendant Raymond E Marshall in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM219 and 15CM283 called. No agreement.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

Defendant Raymond E Marshall in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde for today.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM283 and 15CM219 called.  Attorney Hinde relates.  15CM219 will remain on the calendar for 2:00 pm today.
15CM283 Qualifies for Public Defender and Attorney Raymond will represent.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond set.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
